The noun raʕal- exceptionally lacks an oblique stem. Normally, LAT markers are attached to oblique stems, but here it coincides with the nominative form.

comms_internal: CV. It is not possible to view Y (‘Marjam’) as a clause-level dependent. The only possible way to use it in a non-adjacent position to pikrabaz-da is to use it as an afterthought, sth. like “Г1али пикрабазда вуго (Али в раздумьях), Марьямил” ‘Ali is thinking. About Marjam’.

comms_internal: Here, χadu-AGR functions as a postposition. Baxu confirmed that χadu-w is a(n inflected) postposition that cannot be separated from the Y noun phrase. Even if the Y argument is fronted, the postposition should be fronted as well: Марьямида хадув Г1али вуго, Г1алида хадуй Фатима йиго, Фатимата хадув Ах1мад вуго.
